sen.j: 鞍馬駅（くらまえき）は、京都府京都市左京区鞍馬本町にある叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Kurama Honmachi, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Kurama Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, which is operated by the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kurama Station, located in Kurama Honmachi, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kurama Line, which is operated by the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kurama Station, located in Kurama Honmachi, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kurama Line, which is operated by Eizan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 叡山電鉄→Eizan Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 終着駅である。
sen.e: Kurama Station is the last stop on the Kurama Line.
Kurama Station is the last stop on the Kurama Line.
Kurama Station is the last stop on the Kurama Line.

sen.j: スルッとKANSAIのカードが使用できる駅としては最北端に当たる。
sen.e: Kurama Station is the northernmost station among the stations at which KANSAI THRU PASS can be used.
Kurama Station is the northernmost station among the stations at which KANSAI THRU PASS can be used.
Kurama Station is the northernmost station among the stations at which KANSAI THRU PASS can be used.

sen.j: 接続する鉄道路線
sen.e: Connecting railway lines
Connecting railway lines
Connecting railway lines

sen.j: 宗教法人鞍馬寺
sen.e: Religious corporation, Kurama-dera Temple
Kurama-dera Temple, a religious corporation
Kurama-dera Temple, a religious corporation

sen.j: 鞍馬山鋼索鉄道山門駅（徒歩で約5分。山門（仁王門）をくぐってすぐにある。）
sen.e: Mount Kurama Cable Railway, Sanmon Station (About five minutes on foot after passing the Sanmon (Nio-mon Gate), temple gate.)
Mount Kurama Cable Railway, Sanmon Station (about five minutes on foot after passing the Sanmon (Nio-mon Gate) temple gate.
Mount Kurama Cable Railway, Sanmon Station (about five minutes on foot after passing the Sanmon (temple gate) (Nio-mon Gate).
sen.cmt: 山門（仁王門）→Sanmon (temple gate) (Nio-mon Gate) としました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 島式1面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: Kurama Station is an aboveground station with one island platform serving two tracks.
Kurama Station is an aboveground station with one island platform serving two tracks.
Kurama Station is an aboveground station with one island platform serving two tracks.

sen.j: 出入り口は分離されており、出口のすぐ外側ににトイレが設置されている。
sen.e: The entrance and exit of the station are separated; the toilet is installed just outside the exit.
The entrance and exit of the station are separate, and a toilet facility is provided just outside the exit.
The entrance and exit of the station are separate, and a toilet facility is provided just outside the exit.

sen.j: 出入り口とも自動改札機がある。
sen.e: Automatic ticket gates are installed at both the entrance and the exit.
Automatic ticket gates are in place at the entrance and the exit.
Automatic ticket gates are in place at the entrance and the exit.

sen.j: 駅舎は寺院風の歴史を感じさせる木造建築である。
sen.e: The station is a wooden building in a historical temple style.
The station is a wooden building in a historical temple style.
The station is a wooden building in a historical temple style.

sen.j: 早朝・深夜以外は駅員が配置されている。
sen.e: The staff is stationed except for the early morning and late-evening.
The station is manned at hours other than the early morning and late evening.
The station is manned at hours other than the early morning and late evening.

sen.j: また、自動券売機が設置されており、9時30分から～16時30分（観光シーズン等は延長あり）まで稼動する。
sen.e: The automatic ticket machine is installed, which is operated from 9:30 to 16:30 (the time period is extended during the tourist seasons).
The automatic ticket machine is in operation from 9:30 to 16:30 (this time period is extended during the tourist seasons).
The automatic ticket machine is in operation from 9:30 to 16:30 (this time period is extended during the tourist seasons).

sen.j: 駅員が配置されている間は、出町柳からの電車が着いて、到着した乗客がすべて下車するまでは、入口の自動改札機前にロープが張られて駅構内に入場できない。
sen.e: While the staff is stationed, the automatic ticket gate at the entrance is roped not to have a person enter the station until all the passengers leave the train arriving from Demachiyanagi Station.

During periods in which the station is manned, the automatic ticket gate at the entrance is roped off to prevent anyone from entering the station until all the passengers have left the train arriving from Demachiyanagi Station.

During periods in which the station is manned, the automatic ticket gate at the entrance is roped off to prevent anyone from entering the station until all the passengers have left the train arriving from Demachiyanagi Station.

sen.j: 無人時間帯は電車にて無人駅と同様の扱いを行う。
sen.e: While the staff is not stationed, tickets are purchased and collected on the train like an unmanned station.
At times in which the station isn't manned, tickets are purchased and collected on the train in the manner of an unmanned station.
At times in which the station isn't manned, tickets are purchased and collected on the train in the manner of an unmanned station.

sen.j: 駅舎は閉鎖されていて、駅舎左側を回り有人時間帯の出口横の通路よりホームに入る。
sen.e: The station building is kept closed and passengers enter the platform from the passage beside the exit which is used during the manned period by going around the left side of the building.
The station building is kept closed, and passengers enter the platform from the passage beside the exit, which is used during the manned period by going around the left side of the building.
The station building is kept closed, and passengers enter the platform from the passage beside the exit, which is used during the manned period by going around the left side of the building.

sen.j: 駅前からホームまではほぼ平面である。
sen.e: In front of the station and the platform are substantially on the same level.
The front of the station and the platform are essentially on the same level.
The front of the station and the platform are essentially on the same level.

sen.j: 自動改札も車椅子対応の幅広のものになっている。
sen.e: The automatic ticket gate is wide enough for wheelchairs to pass.
The automatic ticket gate is sufficiently wide to allow a person in a wheelchair to enter.
The automatic ticket gate is sufficiently wide to allow a person in a wheelchair to enter.

sen.j: 出口側は通常の自動改札であるが横の通路から可能。
sen.e: The automatic ticket gate on the exit is a standard type but a person in wheelchair can enter the platform through a passage by the ticket gate.
The automatic ticket gate at the exit is a standard type, but a person in a wheelchair can enter the platform through a passage by the ticket gate.
The automatic ticket gate at the exit is a standard type, but a person in a wheelchair can enter the platform through a passage by the ticket gate.

sen.j: 駅前に天狗のオブジェ、構内に長年この線を走り続けた叡山電鉄デナ21形電車の先頭部と動輪が保存されている。
sen.e: In front of the station is an objet of Tengu, braggart, while in the station are the top part and the driving wheel of the car: Dena Type 21, which was operated by the Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway) and traveled on this line for a long time.

In front of the station is a statue of Tengu (the braggart), while in the station are the top part and the driving wheel of the Dena Type 21 car, which was operated by Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway) and traveled on this line for many years.

In front of the station is a statue of Tengu (the braggart), while in the station are the top part and the driving wheel of the Dena Type 21 car, which was operated by Eizan Electric Railway and traveled on this line for many years.
sen.cmt: 叡山電鉄→Eizan Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 1番線
sen.e: Track 1
Track 1
Platform 1

sen.j: 鞍馬線（宝ヶ池・出町柳方面）
sen.e: Kurama Line (for Takaragaike Station and Demachiyanagi Station)
Kurama Line (for Takaragaike Station and Demachiyanagi Station)
Kurama Line (for Takaragaike Station and Demachiyanagi Station)

sen.j: 2番線
sen.e: Track 2
Track 2
Platform 2

sen.j: 鞍馬線（宝ヶ池・出町柳方面）
sen.e: Kurama Line (for Takaragaike Station and Demachiyanagi Station)
Kurama Line (for Takaragaike Station and Demachiyanagi Station)
Kurama Line (for Takaragaike Station and Demachiyanagi Station)

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 駅前は小さいながら広場を持つ。
sen.e: The station has a square (although it is small) in front of it.
The station has a square (although it is small) in front of it.
The station has a square (although it is small) in front of it.

sen.j: 半分は駐車場となっているが、回りには前記天狗のオブジェやみやげもの屋などがあり、くらま温泉の送迎バスなども発着する。
sen.e: Half of the square is a car parking space surrounded by the objet of Tengu, braggart, and souvenir shops, where the courtesy bus to Kurama Onsen Hot Spring arrives and departs.
Half of the square is a car parking space near to which are the statue of Tengu (the braggart) and souvenir shops, where the courtesy bus to Kurama Onsen Hot Spring arrives and departs.
Half of the square is a car parking space near to which are the statue of Tengu (the braggart) and souvenir shops, where the courtesy bus to Kurama Onsen Hot Spring arrives and departs.

sen.j: 鞍馬街道に出て左に行くとすぐに鞍馬寺の山門がある。
sen.e: Soon after waking on the Kurama Kaido Road, there is a temple gate of the Kurama-dera Temple to the left.
A short walk on the Kurama Kaido Road brings one to a temple gate of Kurama-dera Temple, which is toward the left.
A short walk on the Kurama Kaido Road brings one to a temple gate of Kurama-dera Temple, which is toward the left.

sen.j: 街道沿いには昔ながらの民家も多く残っている。
sen.e: There still remains a number of old houses along the road.
Various old houses can be seen along the road.
Various old houses can be seen along the road.

sen.j: 山間の狭い所にある集落であり、農耕地は主に駅と反対側の民家裏に少し存在する程度である。
sen.e: They form a narrow village between the mountains; a few farmlands exist mainly on the opposite side of the station, behind the houses.
They form a narrow village between the mountains; a bit of farmland exists as well, mainly behind the houses on the opposite side of the station.
They form a narrow village between the mountains; a bit of farmland exists as well, mainly behind the houses on the opposite side of the station.

sen.j: 現在でも観光以外としては林業が中心であるが、京都市中心部まで40～50分であり通勤者も少なからずある。
sen.e: Even now, forestry is the major industry other than tourism, but there are also commuters who commute to the center of Kyoto City for 40 to 50 minutes.
Even today, forestry is the major industry other than tourism, but there are also commuters who take the 40- to 50-minute trip to the center of Kyoto City.
Even today, forestry is the major industry other than tourism, but there are also commuters who take the 40- to 50-minute trip to the center of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 鞍馬寺
sen.e: Kurama-dera Temple
Kurama-dera Temple
Kurama-dera Temple

sen.j: 鞍馬山
sen.e: Kurama-yama Mountain
Kurama-yama Mountain
Mt. Kurama

sen.j: 由岐神社
sen.e: Yuki-jinja Shrine
Yuki-jinja Shrine

sen.j: 鞍馬郵便局
sen.e: Kurama Post Office
The Kurama post office
The Kurama post office

sen.j: くらま温泉
sen.e: Kurama Onsen Hot Spring
Kurama Onsen Hot Spring
Kurama Onsen Hot Spring

sen.j: 京都府道38号京都広河原美山線（鞍馬街道）
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture Road 38, Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road)
Kyoto Prefectural Road 38, Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road)
Kyoto Prefectural Route 38: Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road)
sen.cmt: 道路表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 鞍馬（駅から府道に出た所）
sen.e: Kurama (on the Prefecture Road by walking from the station)
Kurama (reachable via the Prefectural Road by walking from the station)
Kurama (reachable via the Prefectural Route by walking from the station)

sen.j: 京都バス32系統 出町柳駅～北大路駅～鞍馬～広河原（通年運行）
sen.e: Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd. Route 32: Demachiyanagi Station - Kitaoji Station - Kurama - Hirogawara (year-round operation)
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd. Route 32: Demachiyanagi Station - Kitaoji Station - Kurama - Hirogawara (year-round operation)
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd. Route 32: Demachiyanagi Station - Kitaoji Station - Kurama - Hirogawara (year-round operation)

sen.j: 京都バス95系統「北山バーディ号」 大原～鞍馬（春分の日から11月30日までの休日運行）
sen.e: Kyoto Bus Co.,Ltd. Route 95: 'Kitayama Birdie' Ohara - Kurama (operated on holidays between Spring Equinox Day and November 30)
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd., Route 95: 'Kitayama Birdie' Ohara - Kurama (operated on holidays between Spring Equinox Day and November 30)
Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd., Route 95: 'Kitayama Birdie' Ohara - Kurama (operated on holidays between Spring Equinox Day and November 30)

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）10月20日 鞍馬電気鉄道の鞍馬仮駅が開業。
sen.e: On October 20, 1929 a provisional Kurama Station was opened, operated by the Kurama Denki Tetsudo Railway.
On October 20, 1929. a provisional Kurama Station was opened, being operated by the Kurama Denki Tetsudo Railway.
October 20, 1929: A provisional Kurama Station was opened, being operated by the Kurama Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 月日、コロン の表現に統一しました。鞍馬電気鉄道→Kurama Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）12月20日 鞍馬電気鉄道の鞍馬駅（現駅）が開業。
sen.e: On December 20, 1929 Kurama Station (the current station) was opened, operated by the Kurama Denki Tetsudo Railway.
On December 20, 1929, Kurama Station (the current station) was opened under the operation of the Kurama Denki Tetsudo Railway.
December 20, 1929: Kurama Station (the current station) was opened under the operation of the Kurama Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 月日、コロン の表現に統一しました。鞍馬電気鉄道→Kurama Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 鞍馬仮駅廃止。
sen.e: The provisional Kurama Station was discontinued.
The provisional Kurama Station was discontinued.
The provisional Kurama Station was discontinued.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 会社合併により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On August 1, 1942 the station came to be operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. as a result of amalgamation.
On August 1, 1942, the station came to be operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., as a result of amalgamation.
August 1, 1942: The station came to be operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., as a result of amalgamation.
sen.cmt: 月日、コロン の表現に統一しました。

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社再編により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: On April 1, 1986, the station came to be operated by the Eizan Electric Railway as a result of reorganization of companies.
On April 1, 1986, the station came under the operation of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.
April 1, 1986: The station came under the operation of the Eizan Electric Railway due to the reorganization of companies.
sen.cmt: 月日、コロン の表現に統一しました。

sen.j: 第1回近畿の駅百選に選定されている。
sen.e: The station was selected as one of the stations in the First Selection of 100 Famous Stations in the Kinki region.
The station was chosen in the first selection of 100 famous stations in the Kinki region.
The station was chosen in the first selection of 100 famous stations in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 京都模型より「昭和の駅舎シリーズと」して1/150サイズペーパーキットモデルが発売されている。
sen.e: A 1/150 size paper kit model of the station has been sold by the Kyoto Mokei, as one of 'Showa no ekisha Series (post-house in Showa Series).'
A 1/150th scale paper model kit of the station has been sold by the Kyoto Mokei as one of 'Showa no ekisha Series (post-house in Showa Series).'
A 1/150th scale paper model kit of the station has been sold by the Kyoto Mokei as one of 'Showa no ekisha Series (post-house in Showa Series).'

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
